body: It's a little useful, Should we add it?
`yii\log\Target::$enabled` could support closures - then you could filter logs by anything, for example all activity of users with specific role.

I don't think it's a particularly good idea. If the application is structured properly, a set of classes is typically used in multiple URLs so it's better to stick to categories. If you still need that, @rob006 provided a solution.
@samdark This is not a solution - right now `yii\log\Target::$enabled` does not support closures, so you can't use it.

issue.title: Fixes #14273: yii\log\Target::$enabled now supports callable value

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Added posibility to use callable in yii\log\Target::$enabled

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #14273

body: @cebe could you briefly give an example of how to use this new addition?

@bologer define log targets for everything you need to be logged and configure the 'enabled' property by checking the current request for whatever you need, so it only logs things when the condition is true.
